sentences.en: "That was one of the best races of my life," said an elated Hakkinen.
sentences.cn: “那是我一生中表现最好的比赛之一，”哈基宁兴高采烈地说。

sentences.en: By fits she was elated at the notion of being lady of the manor.
sentences.cn: 有时候,她一想到自己是个女领主就得意洋洋.

sentences.en: Dr Grantly returned from Oxford, happy and elated.
sentences.cn: 格伦雷博士由牛津回来,满心欢喜, 兴高采烈.

sentences.en: For my part, I feel elated and close to tears.
sentences.cn: 就我而言，我感到非常高兴，都快落泪了。

sentences.en: He became very elated at the news.
sentences.cn: 他听到这个消息非常喜欢.

sentences.en: He felt elated and mildly drunk.
sentences.cn: 他感到欢欣鼓舞，而且喝得有点醉了。

sentences.en: He walked on with her, elated beyond words, so delightful had been the result.
sentences.cn: 他继续和她往前走着.这么令人高兴的结果让他兴奋得难以形容.

sentences.en: He was greatly elated by success.
sentences.cn: 他因获得成功而得意洋洋.
她的成功使全家人兴高采烈.

sentences.en: I was elated to see the rapid development of the people's cultural life.
sentences.cn: 看到这精彩的演出,怎能不为这艺术幼芽的成长而感到万分欣喜呢?

sentences.en: She was elated at / by the news.
sentences.cn: 她听到这个消息喜出望外.

sentences.en: She was satisfied with her success, but not elated.
sentences.cn: 她对自己的成功很满意, 但并不得意洋洋.

sentences.en: The autumn air , blithe and vivacious, elated Philip.
sentences.cn: 秋天的空气愉快而舒畅, 使菲利浦意气风发.

sentences.en: They were elated at the result.
sentences.cn: 他们对这一结果感到欢欣鼓舞。

sentences.en: We were all elated to hear of the victory that we had won.
sentences.cn: 听到我们胜利了,大家都感到欢欣鼓舞.

trans.tran_cn: 兴高采烈的，得意洋洋的
trans.tran_en: extremely happy and excited, especially because of something that has happened or is going to happen

trans.tran_cn: 使兴奋（elate的过去式和过去分词）
